net.xuset.objectIO.util.scanners

Class HostFinder

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.xuset.objectIO.util.scanners.HostFinder

  • public class HostFinder
extends java.lang.Object
    Scans hosts on the ipv4 /24 block of a given address. An instance of HostFinder is used to determine if the host is acceptable. If the host is acceptable it is added to a list. The acceptable hosts can be found by calling createHostsList().
    Since:
    1.0

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HostFinder(HostChecker checker, int threads)
      Starts a new scan with the given HostChecker object.
      HostFinder(HostChecker checker, int threads, java.net.InetAddress addr)
      Starts a new scan with the given HostChecker object, and the given address.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HostFinder

        public HostFinder(HostChecker checker,
          int threads)
           throws java.net.UnknownHostException
        Starts a new scan with the given HostChecker object. The scan is started on the local subnet.
        Parameters:
        checker - the checker used to determine if an address is acceptable
        threads - the amount of threads to use
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if the local address could not be determined

      • HostFinder

        public HostFinder(HostChecker checker,
          int threads,
          java.net.InetAddress addr)
        Starts a new scan with the given HostChecker object, and the given address.
        Parameters:
        checker - the checker used to determine if an address is acceptable
        threads - the amount of threads to use
        addr - the address to start the scan on. The scan uses the last 8 bits of the given address to determine what hosts to scan.

    • Method Detail

      • cancelScan

        public void cancelScan()
        Cancels the scan and waits for the threads to stop.

      • isScanning

        public boolean isScanning()
        Indicates if the scan is still running.
        Returns:
        true if the scan is still running

      • createHostsList

        public java.util.List<java.net.InetAddress> createHostsList()
        Creates the lists of accepted hosts. It is best to call this after the scan has completed to get the full results
        Returns:
        List containing all the accepted hosts

      • waitForCompletion

        public void waitForCompletion(long timeout)
        Blocks until the scan completes or the timeout is reached
        Parameters:
        timeout - the max amount of time to wait for the scan to complete in milliseconds
